intro: Mitracarpus frigidus var. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous frosty mitracarpus, is a rare and specialized plant adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts upon maturity. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
